channel.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
channel.description:
Hey,
I'm an old fan of RSC from about 15 years ago, and I've recently discovered this little community. I'm just trying to gauge where things stand currently. From what I can gather, a handful of people are still around, and there are lots of different servers floating around, all with their own unique features, generally ones that try to liven the game up a bit with faster XP gain and an emphasis on PvP and clans. Does this sound about right?
Most of the links I've found are dead, but I did manage to find a copy of the source code for EasyRSC's client and server. There were a few problems with it, but I finally managed to get it up and running for myself. It looks pretty true to the original game, with a few odd features added and a new login screen, etc.
I've been trying to work out where the source code has actually come from. A lot of it looks like it has been decompiled due to the lack of comments and variable names. And since a lot of functionality is missing from the server, presumably much of the source was obtained from an early version, and it's been added to over the years in an attempt to bring it more in line with the official servers?
Anyway, I'm just curious - does anyone still play RSC? What servers do people generally play on? And what features do you look for in a server?
Personally I'm trying to bring this source code back to a more vanilla state, but that's mainly just for personal use.
Cheers, Danjb

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Danjb Danjb
item.description:
@Danjb wrote:

Thanks brwn - it certainly seems that way.

Nonetheless, I think I have everything I need for now to continue my own development. Currently I’m just refactoring the code and trying to get a better understanding of the various variables and data structures. The main problem I’ve found is that player movement is very slow and stuttery; I click somewhere, and the player moves a few steps and a time and keeps pausing along the way. I’d like to make this smoother so that the movement is constant.

Other things on my “wishlist”:

  • Better camera control (someone has tried to add zooming but it’s a bit broken).
  • Option to change resolution in-game.
  • Get the XP rate back to normal.
  • Fix missing NPC / object behaviour.
  • Fix various typos.
  • “In-game” landscape editor.
  • RS2-style equipment menu.
  • Somehow make it more fun to play over a LAN…

Read full topic
item.source: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @brwn brwn
item.description:
@brwn wrote:

DanJB
Topic: What’s the current status of RuneScape Classic?

Unfortunately, all the reply’s you received on this topic is the current status of RSC at least on moparscape, I’m sure other boards too.
Its hard to find any help, or have any question answered.

But yes the community is small, and split.
I’ve played most of the servers that are online today, its really about which you like best.

As far as continuing with easyrsc or any kind of RSC development, based on my personal attempts, it is hard to find help/ask questions on these forums.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Danjb Danjb
item.description:
@Danjb wrote:

I’m not too worried about the language, I just don’t want to reinvent the wheel by making changes that others have already made.

Nonetheless, I’ll have a look at the ones you mentioned. Do you have any links to the source?

Read full topic

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“Danjb, post:20, topic:553009”]Thanks guys!

I’ll definitely check out that updated source, maybe I can somehow merge it with my own.

EDIT: Is that the source code for just the server? Which client should I use?[/quote]
Honestly do no use Mopar as starting template.

It uses scala and isn’t of the best to start any type of learning.

Use Java 8 and try Elysium, RSCA or RSCD v25 and learn about the bugs and fix them.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Welcome… well the client is decompiled and almost every private server comes from the leaked source of rscdaemon that was made by Reines author of skulltorcha (an old rsc bot) and that’s about it. The 6-7 years after that to this day there’s a lot of server admins fights, ddos, scamming, leeching, death etc.

here are the protocols and stuff
http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/Category-RSC

updated source
https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic

hope it helps

Read full topic

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Danjb Danjb
item.description:
@Danjb wrote:

Thanks for the explanation. Is there a summary somewhere of all the major revisions?

I guess it’s kind of inevitable that a community such as this would die after all these years. RSC is pretty old and obscure these days. Kudos to you guys for keeping it alive so long, though.

So much nostalgia :’)

item.description:
@Tim_Dog wrote:

mona lisa never adds any value in his posts because he simply is not able to LOL

on Topic:

you can Play real RSC on 3 Servers
with a Population of ~200 Players.
i would estimate that 95% of Players are botting.
pking is non existent,
staking is the Name of the game.
the community is tiny and
for a Long time dying.

item.source: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Danjb, post:13, topic:553009”]Yeah, I got that vibe from some of the posts I’ve read.
So maybe there are still a few private servers, but it sounds like most of the RSC scene has died.

In that case - what were some of the better features of private servers back when RSC was popular? I doubt I’ll ever host a public server since it’s probably quite expensive, but I’d be interested to hear what works well and what doesn’t. I expect I’ll keep tinkering with the source for a while, maybe make it a bit more fun to play over a LAN. So far I’ve just added support for high-resolutions and done some tidying of the code.

EDIT: Also, can someone please explain to me a bit about the different client/server revisions? I’ve noticed people referring to them by numbers but I don’t know what each revision adds. I also have no idea which revision I’ve downloaded. It seems to contain thieving, not sure about herblaw and agility, and most quests aren’t implemented… are there revisions available where these things have been implemented?[/quote]well hosting a server isnt too expensive actually, i dont do rsc, i do rs2, and even for that its not too expensive provided youre not one of the big shot servers with 1k+ players, and im sure thats more intensive than rsc. Over time you kind of just memorize landmark revisions, at least thats how it was for me in rs2 (194, 289, 317, 377, 414, 453, 459, 474, 498, 508, 525, etc.) They are usually better/well known not because they have some game changing update (some do) but because there is some knowledge on it and a decent cache dump for the revision for models and so on so forth

Read full topic

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Danjb Danjb
item.description:
@Danjb wrote:

Yeah, I got that vibe from some of the posts I’ve read.
So maybe there are still a few private servers, but it sounds like most of the RSC scene has died.

In that case - what were some of the better features of private servers back when RSC was popular? I doubt I’ll ever host a public server since it’s probably quite expensive, but I’d be interested to hear what works well and what doesn’t. I expect I’ll keep tinkering with the source for a while, maybe make it a bit more fun to play over a LAN. So far I’ve just added support for high-resolutions and done some tidying of the code.

EDIT: Also, can someone please explain to me a bit about the different client/server revisions? I’ve noticed people referring to them by numbers but I don’t know what each revision adds. I also have no idea which revision I’ve downloaded. It seems to contain thieving, not sure about herblaw and agility, and most quests aren’t implemented… are there revisions available where these things have been implemented?

Read full topic

item.title: What's the current status of RuneScape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

By rsc if you mean the official servers? Since jagex kind of locked them up i cant imagine too much activity there, not to mention that bots are free to roam about over there.

As for here? I think theres a few servers still going good but dont take my word for it, though one thing i have noticed is that theres alot of bad blood between servers/suspicious ownership of servers
